title: 15 Dog-Safe Plants You Can Add to Your Garden Right Now
author: Kiki Kane
description: If you have pets and love a beautiful garden too, you'll want to take extra care in choosing what to plant. Check out these dog-safe plants.
cleaned_text: - This post contains affiliate links. Read more [here](https://www.rover.com/blog/affiliate-disclosure/). - Not a substitute for professional veterinary help. Looking to spruce up your garden or balcony, but unsure which plants are safe for dogs? We've done some of the legwork for you with this list of 15 dog-safe plants and garden favorites that will add beauty and color to your yard without posing any threat to your pup. Keep in mind the varieties on this list are specific—for example, while African daisies may be harmless to dogs, other varieties of daisies are considered toxic. If you're interested in learning about what plants are poisonous to cats, or about other plants not on this list that may be poisonous to pets, check out our guide [Poisonous Plants to Dogs and Cats](https://www.rover.com/blog/poisonous-plants/). 15 Dog-Safe Plants for Color, Variety, and Fragrance Many of these dog-safe plants are available at your local home and garden or hardware store as seeds, starts, or potted plants. You can also find good deals on seeds online at [Burpee](https://go.skimresources.com?id=124407X1602009&xs=1&xcust=-RU-OT-March%202022-&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.burpee.com%2F), [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/s?k=flower+seeds&i=lawngarden&crid=3UXMZDCJS6PO0&sprefix=flower+seeds%2Clawngarden%2C180&ref=nb_sb_noss&tag=march2022rover-20), and other gardening sites. [Camellia](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B071K9XTG1?tag=march2022rover-20) These flowering shrubs take some work to establish, but once they're firmly rooted in your garden, they'll keep coming back each year with little effort. Camellias prefer partial shade, and mature plants are able to survive with little watering. If the plant is brand new, it will require some watering to establish its roots. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B071K9XTG1?tag=march2022rover-20) [Dill](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00AX2K14K?tag=march2022rover-20) Culinary dill is obviously safe for humans, but this feathery weed is also a dog-safe plant. This herb goes well in creamy dressings, soups, and meats. Just make sure you give it plenty of room to grow—these plants get bigger than you would expect. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00AX2K14K?tag=march2022rover-20) [Dog-Safe Garden Marigold Plants](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07WT6ZWHF?tag=march2022rover-20) These flowers aren't just beautiful—they also help bring bees to your garden and act as [a form of natural pest control](https://www.seattletimes.com/life/lifestyle/do-marigolds-keep-pests-away-or-are-they-just-pretty/) that can deter beetles and other harmful bugs from infesting your edible plants. Their stunning, sun-like blooms aren't too bad either. A dog-safe plant that's a win-win all around! [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07WT6ZWHF?tag=march2022rover-20) [Fuchsias](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08MT1MT6J?tag=march2022rover-20) These elegant pink and purple flowers look great in hanging baskets outdoors. They do best in mild, temperate climates like the Pacific Northwest, and they can remain in bloom from late spring to late fall. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08MT1MT6J?tag=march2022rover-20) [Magnolia Bushes](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GBLD89Q?tag=march2022rover-20) Most people think of large, stately trees when they picture magnolias, but this dog-safe plant also grows as a bush. Most magnolia bushes offer spectacular flowers in purple, pink, or white. They do well in full sun if you can give it to them. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01GBLD89Q?tag=march2022rover-20) [Dog-Safe Purple Basil Plant](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BGGQCXQ?tag=march2022rover-20) This gorgeous variety of basil whips up into a delicious (purple) pesto and also brings stunning color to your garden beds. Plant these guys after all chance of frost is over, and give them plenty of water and a place in the sun. Cut and eat what you want, and you and your dog can enjoy it in the garden until the first frost of the year. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00BGGQCXQ?tag=march2022rover-20) [Creeping Thyme](https://www.amazon.com/Outsidepride-Mother-Creeping-Thyme-Ground/dp/B003ZJ92I4?tag=april2022rover-20) Another practical herb that won't harm your pets, thyme is a perennial plant that doesn't need a lot of attention and is a great ground cover. Just a little water and sun, and it's good to go. This herb pairs well with roasted vegetables, meat, soups, and potatoes. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Outsidepride-Mother-Creeping-Thyme-Ground/dp/B003ZJ92I4?tag=april2022rover-20) [Sunflower](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07QBK5BM2?tag=march2022rover-20) Sunflowers are the epitome of summer. This annual plant is available in a huge range of sizes and colors. These dog-safe plants can grow several feet tall, make a great border along fences or in front of the house, and love a sunny spot with plenty of water. As sunflowers lose their bright petals, the seeds mature and attract birds through the fall. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07QBK5BM2?tag=march2022rover-20) [Rosemary](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08KZLT7XJ?tag=march2022rover-20) All rosemary is suitable for culinary use and is considered a dog-safe plant, but a creeping variety is a hardy way to fill empty spaces in your yard with a low, fluffy cloud of evergreen. The trailing stems look especially beautiful cascading over the edge of a raised bed or container. This sun-loving ground cover will release a waft of scent whenever your dog scampers through. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08KZLT7XJ?tag=march2022rover-20) [Coral Bells](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004I0C2J0?tag=march2022rover-20) Coral bells grow low mounds of leaves in a range of shades from green to orange to black, with small sprigs of tiny flowers on long stems waving far above. There are many varieties to choose from, but this variegated variety is a real stunner. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B004I0C2J0?tag=march2022rover-20) [Dog-Safe Pineapple Sage Plant](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0140J5OB6?tag=march2022rover-20) Pineapple sage smells amazing, attracts hummingbirds with its pink tubular flowers, and is a tasty addition to everything from fruit salads and salsas to sangria. It's generally considered an annual but may come back in spring if your winter is mild enough. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0140J5OB6?tag=march2022rover-20) [Dog-Safe Polka Dot Plant](https://www.amazon.com/Outsidepride-Hypoestes-Pink-Polka-Plant/dp/B004I40JFA?tag=march2022rover-20) This low-growing, shade-loving, dog-safe plant adds a splash of pink all summer long. It's perennial in warm climates and even makes for a nice houseplant. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Outsidepride-Hypoestes-Pink-Polka-Plant/dp/B004I40JFA?tag=march2022rover-20) [Fennel](https://www.amazon.com/Sow-Right-Seeds-Planting-Instructions/dp/B08PSN61LC?tag=march2022rover-20) This tasty bulb has beautiful feathery foliage and the flavor of licorice. While it's safe for dogs, it's even better for humans: it's delicious grilled and makes a fragrant addition to salads. The seeds are a great breath freshener and make a soothing tea. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Sow-Right-Seeds-Planting-Instructions/dp/B08PSN61LC?tag=march2022rover-20) [Snapdragons ](https://www.amazon.com/Snapdragon-Premium-Heirloom-Beautiful-Garden/dp/B07QG5N61W?tag=march2022rover-20) Everyone loves a sunny snapdragon patch. These dog-safe plants are easy to grow from seed in full sun, and produce a range of colors from yellow to red on tall stems. They make great cut flower arrangements too. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Snapdragon-Premium-Heirloom-Beautiful-Garden/dp/B07QG5N61W?tag=march2022rover-20) [Nasturtium](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B078H1BSFH?tag=march2022rover-20) Nasturtiums are my favorite annual flowers to grow for a few reasons. The flowers are edible and have a surprising spicy flavor. Nasturtiums grow in poorer soils and they do not need fertilizers, so you can plant them in the odd spots in your yard. They drape down garden boxes and rock walls with colorful elegance, and they smell like heaven. [Find on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B078H1BSFH?tag=march2022rover-20) No matter how you garden, whether it's in a big, beautiful backyard or on a sunny windowsill, we hope it's always relaxing for you and safe for your pets. Happy planting! Which Plants Aren't Dog-Safe? Now that you have 15 great options for your garden, you may be wondering if the plants you already have in your yard or home are safe for your furry friend. Never fear!
